climbs.name: Warm Up Route Right Most Anchors

content.description: Climbers right most set of anchors.  Follows enjoyable finger dihedral crack for about 15 feet.
content.protection: Top rope.  3 bolts.  Bring long slings to get rope over edge.

climbs.name: Warm Up Route Left Most Anchors

content.description: These are the anchors that are to the climbers left.  To access them scramble up the small slope to the left of the wall and around the backside.  There is a small break in the wall which leads out to an exposed ledge that allows for you to set up a top rope belay.  3 bolts.  Bring long slings to get the rope over the edge.  The climbs here are in the 5.10 range with their being a right side and a left side variation.

climbs.name: Smoking Monk
climbs.fa: FA: Kevin Hutchinson FFA: Alan Kline

content.description: This is a beautiful chunk of rock. The fin that Smoking Monk resides on is a very obvious feature in the valley and begs to be climbed. This route gets progressively harder from start to finish, with a couple boulder problem cruxes that are tricky to figure out. Kevin Hutchinson calls this "the best climb in Paradise Valley."
content.location: Scramble up to a small ledge left of the route, follow bolts to the top.
